Deficiency Narrative: Staff records reviewed indicated Psychotropic medication training had expired.
Correction Narrative: Email was received showing staff training was completed and updated.

Deficiency Narrative: One child medication log reviewed showed a child received same medication twice for 3 days.
Correction Narrative: CCR Inspector went to the facility and counted medication to make sure the logs and medication matched.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 of 3 files looked at did not have completed admission assessments.
Correction Narrative: On June 13, 2024 the Administrator emailed a copy of  the new Admission Assessment. This document was reviewed and found to have all required sections for new placements.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the four requested files were not immediately available and not all information was able to be reviewed.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator and stated the following: all files are being audited by the admin team to ensure all documents are completed; all files will be copied and brought from the HR office to the Shelter by 2/16/2024; moving forward any new info/documents for current files will be scanned and stored electronically and documennts will be printed and put in the paper file within 24 hours; when new hires are onboarded the required documents will be scanned and filed in the electronic and paper files and an employee checklist will be updated to reflect the minimum standards.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's medication was not taken as prescribed.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received on January 23, 2024 stating the following:
-	Shift supervisor will assign specific staff to administer medications.  
-	If a shift supervisor is on shift, they will e responsible to administer medication in both cottages.  
-	If there is limited staff and the supervisor cannot dispense medication in the opposite cottage, Shift Supervisor will be responsible to ensure medication is dispensed accordingly via radio communication.  
-	In the event the person assigned to medication is unable to attend or complete the shift, the on-call supervisor will be notified unless an administrator or supervisor is already on campus. The on-call supervisor will assign a new staff to administer medications.  
-	Shelter Administration will conduct monthly reviews of medication dispensing and management during shelter administration meetings.
-	Staff will regularly updated in staff weekly meetings on any changes in medication protocols and conduct periodic refresher courses.  
-	Shift Supervisors will conduct regular supervision and continuous oversight to monitor medication administration process.  
-	Shift Supervisors will conduct regular medication audits to ensure dispensing compliance.  
-	Shelter Administration will regularly evaluate the effectiveness of the corrective action and make adjustments as needed to ensure sustained improvement in medication administration.  
A walk-through was completed on 2/5/2024  and three children s medication and medication records were reviewed.  These were in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was sufficient evidence to find abuse occurred in the operation.
Correction Narrative: The staff member involved was terminated immediately on the night of the incident.  All staff were required to complete a mandatory virtual training titled "Crisis Prevention & De-Escalation: A Trauma Informed Approach." The training required a pre-test and post-test.  Cameras throughout the cottages are randomly checked at minimum of four hours a month.  The COO, Compliance Officer, Shelter Director, and Assistant Direct are in charge of randomly checking footage at varied times. Times and locations are logged on a spreadsheet managed by the administration team.

Correction Narrative: The staff member involved was terminated immediately on the night of the incident. Cameras throughout the cottages are randomly checked at minimum of four hours a month.  The COO, Compliance Officer, Shelter Director, and Assistant Direct are in charge of randomly checking footage at varied times. Times and locations are logged on a spreadsheet managed by the administration team.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care received the wrong dose of medication.
A child in care did not receive his prescribed medication on 04/10/2023.
Correction Narrative: A child in care did not receive his prescribed medication on 04/10/2023.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children have been in care for over 105 without a placement extension being requested with one still currently placed.
Correction Narrative: On Friday, February 17, 2023 a variance was submitted for the child in care over 90 days.  A spreadsheet is kept with all children's information and when their 90 day deadline is.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care received less medication than prescribed. The perception calls for two pills twice a day, and that child receive one pill, twice a day.
Correction Narrative: A child in care received less medication than prescribed. The perception calls for two pills twice a day, and that child receive one pill, twice a day.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation there was an overdose of a psychotropic medication given to a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Staff was written up and is not allowed to give medication until retrained.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on the interviews during the investigation the child in care did not receive medical attention after being administered medication improperly.
Correction Narrative: The operation is not allowing the staff involved give medication until retrained. The training will be held at the end of the month.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, the medication error was caught by Staff on 7/17 after the 2nd over dosage  was given.  Incident reported to licensing until 7/19. The over dosage was left unreported and child did not receive medical treatment until 7/20.
Correction Narrative: On 09/20 an email from the operation's manager stated that several steps have been taken to prevent additional medication administration errors. On a physical inspection on 09/23 A physical inspection resulting in a discussion with the administrator about the operation's medication  administration changes made in an attempt to address the recent medication errors. An all staff meeting was held with the meeting's minutes including medication errors, medication policy, mediation talk, resident searches, and room searches. The administrator reported that in addition to the meeting the staff have been issued a step by step instruction manual on administering medications, a medication specialist will conduct daily inventory of medications after administration time periods. Staff have been notified of their requirements to report suspected A/N/E and failure to do so will result in disciplinary actions up to termination.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, Victim child was aware of being was overdosed on two separate occasions and vocalized this concern during his interview.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, Victim child was aware of being was overdosed on two separate occasions and vocalized this concern during his interview.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection there were medical errors found on the medication logs that were on 7/13 and 7/15. Staff self corrected the dosage and failed to reported to management until 7/17.
Correction Narrative: A physical inspection resulting in a discussion with the administrator about the operation's medication  administration changes made in an attempt to address the recent medication errors. An all staff meeting was held with the meeting's minutes including medication errors, medication policy, mediation talk, resident searches, and room searches. The administrator reported that in addition to the meeting the staff have been issued a step by step instruction manual on administering medications, a medication specialist will conduct daily inventory of medications after administration time periods. Staff have been notified of their requirements to report suspected A/N/E and failure to do so will result in disciplinary actions up to termination.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection of documents it was found in the medical documentation that a child did not receive medical attention until 5 days after the incident and 3 days after a medical error was found.
Correction Narrative: A physical inspection resulting in a discussion with the administrator about the operation's medication  administration changes made in an attempt to address the recent medication errors. An all staff meeting was held with the meeting's minutes including medication errors, medication policy, mediation talk, resident searches, and room searches. The administrator reported that in addition to the meeting the staff have been issued a step by step instruction manual on administering medications, a medication specialist will conduct daily inventory of medications after administration time periods. Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was found that 6 residents were taken to Dollar General unsupervised inside and were able to steal pills while staff waited in the vehicle. The residents returned to the facility and shared pills amongst each other and several residents were rushed to the hospital due to ingestion.
Correction Narrative: Inspectors received the following information to assist with follow up tasks: Staff and child lists, blank incident reports, updated Level System policy, corrective action for staff on duty at time of incident along with email of corrections. Staff is now PRN due to incident and receiving formal write up. All staff have been reminded of the store request policy that must be completed prior to approval for transporting children off campus.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff were not following protocol when administering medication to children in care resulting in a child in care hiding pills and taking them back to the bedroom.
Correction Narrative:
The Director of the Operation submitted the following as a form of Corrective Action Plan which Indicated the following:

CAP is as follows:

All Staff will be retrained on the medication dispensing, counting, and safety with a Registered Nurse on August 03, 2022.

Medication Logs are checked and reviewed by Staff Supervisor and Assistant Director.

No other children, other than the child being given medication, will be in the room at the time of medication dispensary.

Only medication belonging to the child in the room will be pulled and dispensed.

Staff will make sure the child opens moth and moves tongue around to make sure medication is not hidden in the child's mouth, as well as drinks water.

Any Staff with a Medication Error will lead to a formal coaching to include write - up , and possible termination depending on the severity of the error.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care had a self harm incident on 4/10/22 that lead to the operation calling EMS to give medical attention to the child. The operation failed to report the incident to Licensing until 4/13/22
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's manager stating that the administrator and staff will were made aware to immediately report serious incidents regardless of the medical professional's diagnoses. A formal meeting will be held on 07/06/22 were staff reporting responsibilities will be reviewed in detail and staff will sign an acknowledgement form. A sign in sheet and staff list will be provided to licensing representative following the meeting.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member failed to demonstrate prudent judgement and self control when she engaged in a verbal altercation with a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Correction submitted via email from the administrator stating that the staff member involved received disciplinary action, the importance of professionalism and remaining in control of the situation was discussed, and staff and child apologized to one another and there have been no further issues.

Deficiency Narrative: Four out of the four child files reviewed did not contain any admission documentation in the file regarding known contraindications to the use of restraints.
Correction Narrative: The administrator email a response stating the following: the administrator met with the therapist  to review the proper protocol and procedural documentation of the contraindications of each residents file. When the administrator and assistant administrator has to sign off on the residents service plans and will check to see that the contraindications have been documented and completed correctly. The administrative staff will ensure that if a common application specifically states a particular type of restraint/coping skills is needed it will be documented accordingly and communicated to the direct care staff.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not have the required posting Licensing notice Keeping Children Safe or their permit in a publicly visible place.
In review of medication log, One child's medication log did not documents the child received the medication. On 6-21-2021 the log did not contain a medication count, dose given, or staff signature.
Correction Narrative: I, Brittany Gilcrest RCCR, received an email from Marcel Lue stating the plan of action to Manage the citation, the letter is stored in the file in the investigation. The operation conducted a meeting with the staff to discuss the concern and hosted a training on 10-15-2021 once they learned of the concern. New medication form were designed, Marcel Lue will conducted weekly checks on the medication log and Cathy Reece will report any medication errors to Mr. Lue.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to report the communicable disease to the Texas Abuse and Neglect Hotline more than 24 hours after becoming aware of the positive test results.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent an email response stating that going forward the CEO or the designee will immediately notify the hotline when any type of communicable disease is brought to light.

Deficiency Narrative: One of four child records reviewed was missing the Initial Service Plan.
Correction Narrative:
03/05/2021- The operation submitted 2 pages of something they call the Initial Service Plan.
03/22/2021- The operation was asked to complete the entire Initial Service Plan and submit it by the close of business tomorrow 3/23/2021.
3/23/2021- The operation submitted a copy of the child's Initial Service Plan.

Deficiency Narrative: A male resident was able to hit and  touch a female resident without the knowledge of the staff.
Correction Narrative:
Interviews were conducted with staff members. Agency staff list and CLASS was reviewed to verify that the staff involved in this investigation was terminated as reported. 
12/14/20
Administrative staff held a meeting with the residents to explain the importance of communicating with staff if any resident makes them feel uncomfortable or threatened in any way.
The staff will continually monitor all resident both inside and outside for inappropriate touching of one another. 
I, Marcel Lue, Interim Shelter Director will debrief with shift supervisors any reports of inappropriate sexual touching and or relationships. 
Administrative Staff held a meeting on December 2, 2020 with all direct care staff regarding the Attachment A form documenting known residents sexual behavior issues. 
In early 2021, MCYS Bridgeway Shelter will open up two new cottages, which will separate the males and females. This will lessen the amount of inappropriate relationships with our residents.
